name: oauth.access
desc: Exchanges a temporary OAuth verifier code for an access token.

client_id.desc: Issued when you created your application. If possible, avoid sending `client_id` and `client_secret` as parameters in your request and instead supply the Client ID and Client Secret using the HTTP Basic authentication scheme.

client_secret.desc: Issued when you created your application. If possible, avoid sending `client_id` and `client_secret` as parameters in your request and instead supply the Client ID and Client Secret using the HTTP Basic authentication scheme.

code.desc: The `code` param returned via the OAuth callback.

redirect_uri.desc: This must match the originally submitted URI (if one was sent).

single_channel.desc: Request the user to add your app only to a single channel. Only valid with a [legacy workspace app](https://docs.slack.dev/changelog/2021-03-workspace-apps-to-retire-in-august-2021).

errors.bad_redirect_uri: Value passed for `redirect_uri` did not match the `redirect_uri` in the original request.
errors.code_already_used: Value passed for `code` was already exchanged.
errors.internal_error: Something went wrong during app installation.
errors.ratelimited: Too many requests made in succession.
errors.oauth_authorization_url_mismatch: The OAuth flow was initiated on an incorrect version of the authorization url. The flow must be initiated via /oauth/authorize.
